Putin's choice of a long war in Ukraine
subhead: The suspension of American aid to Kyiv fits neatly into the Russian leader's military plans: to intensify his offensive in Ukraine this summer, and to sustain an endless conflict, now synonymous with the survival of his regime through a newfound 'stability' built on a war economy.

headline: Texas floods: Desperate search for missing as death toll rises
Netanyahu says Trump meeting could 'advance' Gaza deal ahead of Doha talks
Israel launches airstrikes on Yemen's Houthi rebels after ship attack, Houthis respond with missile fire
subhead: The flare-up on Monday, July 7, followed attacks on a vessel in the Red Sea the previous day, for which the Houthis, despite suspicions, made no immediate claim of responsibility. The attack comes as a possible ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war hangs in the balance and as Iran weighs whether to restart negotiations over its nuclear program.

headline: King Charles III to lead 20th-anniversary commemoration of the 7/7 London transit bombings
subhead: The 2005 London transit bombings, which killed 52 people and wounded 700 others, were the deadliest attack on the British capital since World War II.

headline: In Bosnia and Herzegovina, stone treasures, canyons and cypress trees await
subhead: The Balkan country, with its painful past, is rich in historical sites and mountainous landscapes â from the Kravica Waterfalls to the Olympic sites of Sarajevo, from a medieval fortress to Tito's bunker.

headline: The relentless rush to build dams in China's Tiger Leaping Gorge: 'If we lose our land, we lose everything'
subhead: 'The Himalayas Overheating' (5/6). In the far Southwest of China, plans to build massive reservoirs as part of hydroelectric dam projects have condemned dozens of mountain villages to disappear.

Iranian photographer Forough Alaei portrays life during the war: 'Nothing will ever be the same again'
subhead: After the first Israeli bombings in Iran, Iranian photographer Forough Alaei left Tehran to take refuge with her family on the Caspian Sea coast. She documented those days when war plunged them into the unknown.

headline: Starlink: The newest asset for rebel and jihadist groups in West Africa
subhead: Billionaire Elon Musk's satellite internet system has become an increasingly common tool for armed groups to communicate in areas lacking traditional land-based communications infrastructure.

headline: In the jaws of the Jackal: How an informant orchestrated a policewoman's fall
subhead: Sonia C. was still a law enforcement officer when, in April 2024, she was sentenced to three years in prison for handing police files to an informant known as the Jackal. Naivety still marks this former officer, who loved to party until dawn and used cocaine.

headline: Iran's shameful hostage diplomacy
